messages.subject: Re: A reminder from listowner
messages.msgSnippet: ... I definitely am planning to continue perusing other threads, this one just occupied all of tonight. I had briefly peeked at other threads, but since this
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Ren Allen"
<starsuncloud@n...> wrote:

> Welcome. I hope you've had a chance to read some archives, because
> this is usually a very peaceable (lively, but peaceable) list.
> We have passionate folks here as I'm sure you can see..:)
> Not much fence sitting going on.
>
I definitely am planning to continue perusing other threads, this
one just occupied all of tonight. I had briefly peeked at other
threads, but since this one was definitely the hot one of the
moment, we started with it. A new adventure is unfolding, and I am
enjoying it all.
Christina

messages.subject: A reminder from listowner
messages.msgSnippet: My son and I have just joined this group, and we have been reading this thread, and wow, it seems packed with emotion, information, and differing views
messages.messageBody:
"My son and I have just joined this group, and we have been reading
this thread, and wow, it seems packed with emotion, information, and
differing views"

Welcome. I hope you've had a chance to read some archives, because
this is usually a very peaceable (lively, but peaceable) list.
We have passionate folks here as I'm sure you can see..:)
Not much fence sitting going on.

Ren

messages.subject: Re: A reminder from listowner
messages.msgSnippet: ... helping ... radical ... owned ... dedicate ... My son and I have just joined this group, and we have been reading this thread, and wow, it seems packed
messages.messageBody:
--- In unschoolingbasics@yahoogroups.com, "Ren Allen"
<starsuncloud@n...> wrote:
>
> "Well see, my primary goal is not unschooling actually, but
helping
> my
> children grow. So whatever."
>
> If you're not interested in unschooling, nor in discussing how
> unschooling works in your life or how to unschool, this is not the
> list for you.
> It seems you had an agenda upon arriving here or issues with
radical
> unschoolers, or both.
> It matters not. This list is full of radical unschoolers, it's
owned
> by two very radical unschoolers and those interested in the
> discussion of how unschooling affects all of life. Unless
> unschooling is a topic of interest, I suggest you find a list that
> fits your needs elsewhere.
> Sidetracking the list with jabs at the good folks here that
dedicate
> so much of their energy and time to helping others will not be
> tolerated. Posting is a privilege, not a right.
> I welcome future posts on the topic of unschooling. If you have
> issues with radical unschoolers, those posts will have to go
> elsewhere.

My son and I have just joined this group, and we have been reading
this thread, and wow, it seems packed with emotion, information, and
differing views, but I want to say THANK YOU! and David says "ROCK
ON!" to you Ren for what I think of as a "course correction" for
this thread. The whole thread has certainly provided a lot for us to
discuss, which has been a great learning process.

Christina and
David

messages.subject: A reminder from listowner
messages.msgSnippet: Well see, my primary goal is not unschooling actually, but helping my children grow. So whatever. If you re not interested in unschooling, nor in discussing
messages.messageBody:
"Well see, my primary goal is not unschooling actually, but helping
my
children grow. So whatever."

If you're not interested in unschooling, nor in discussing how
unschooling works in your life or how to unschool, this is not the
list for you.

It seems you had an agenda upon arriving here or issues with radical
unschoolers, or both.
It matters not. This list is full of radical unschoolers, it's owned
by two very radical unschoolers and those interested in the
discussion of how unschooling affects all of life. Unless
unschooling is a topic of interest, I suggest you find a list that
fits your needs elsewhere.

Sidetracking the list with jabs at the good folks here that dedicate
so much of their energy and time to helping others will not be
tolerated. Posting is a privilege, not a right.

I welcome future posts on the topic of unschooling. If you have
issues with radical unschoolers, those posts will have to go
elsewhere.

Ren
